\( _{j}_\frac 34 + _{k}_\frac 12 \)
\(= \frac {_{{(4*j)+3}}_}{4} + \frac {_{{(2*k)+1}}_}{2}\) [Converting mixed fractions into improper fractions]
LCM of the denominators of the 2 fractions, i.e. 2 and 4 = 4.
Writing both the fractions with a common denominator, i.e. 4, we get:
\( (\frac {_{{(4*j)+3}}_}{4} \times \frac 11) +(\frac {_{{(2*k)+1}}_}{2} \times \frac 22)\)
\(= \frac {_{{(4*j)+3}}_}{4} + \frac {_{{(4*k)+2}}_}{4}\)
\(= _{{Fraction((4*j)+(4*k)+5, 4)}}_\)
